TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageUrlEditor extends System.Web.UI.Design.UrlEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a user interface for selecting a URL that references an image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ImageUrlEditor> is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> that provides a dialog box for selecting a URL property that references an image.
## Examples [!code-cpp[WebUITypeEditorsExample#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebUITypeEditorsExample/CPP/webcustomcontrol1.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[WebUITypeEditorsExample#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebUITypeEditorsExample/CS/webcustomcontrol1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[WebUITypeEditorsExample#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebUITypeEditorsExample/VB/webcustomcontrol1.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the caption to display on the selection dialog window.
Docs.value: The caption to display on the selection dialog window.

Docs.summary: Gets the file name filter string for the editor. This string is used to determine the items that appear in the file list of the dialog box.
Docs.value: The filter string that can be used to filter the file list of the dialog box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ImageUrlEditor.Filter%2A> property specifies a filter string with two filter options: one for common image file extensions (*.gif, *.jpg, *.jpeg, *.bmp, *.wmf, *.png), and one for all files (\*.\*).
A filter string contains one or more filter options. Each filter option contains a description of the filter, followed by the vertical bar (|) and the filter pattern. The strings for different filtering options are separated by the vertical bar.
The following is an example of a filter string that contains two filter options: "`Bitmap Files (*.bmp)|*.bmp|All Files (*.*)|*.*`".
You can specify several filter patterns in a filter option by separating the filter patterns with semicolons. The following is an example of a filter string in which the first filter option specifies three filter patterns: "`Image Files(*.bmp;*.jpg;*.gif)|*.bmp;*.jpg;*.gif|All Files (*.*)|*.*`".
